name: Inka Pirka Pyramid
description:
3300px x 3300px 300 DPI

120mm film format / Hasselblad 500c camera / Ilford Delta 100 Pro negative. Negatives digitized directly to light onto a Beseler enlarger, via Nikon D750 + Nikkor macro lens.

--Inka Pirka (Ingapirca) sacred site, Cuenca, Ecuador. Cañari-Inca communities, Ecuador.--

The Andes is the backbone of the world. It unfolds every possible gradient. In its center, the most biodiverse area in less extension, sacred ancestral and natural sites reveal the creative power that incites us to create.

All of us who inhabit America ask ourselves: What makes us the land of creativity, solidarity, freshness, warmth, spontaneity, so notoriously? 

Andes holds all these secrets. The way to perceive them is by intuition: look, close your eyes and go to the place. Traveling through the Andes is an internal experience. When senses overflow with overwhelming stimuli, the journey becomes virtual. 

Our roots are immutable.
